intro: Heracleum pubescens var. laeve, commonly known as the smooth cowparsnip, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, compound leaves that are typically hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
